lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He said the United States spends some 25.8 billion dlrs a year to support producer prices and on its export enhancement program and the EC 21.7 billion, while Japan spends only 2.9 billion.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Kato said he welcomed the outcome of last week's recent summit of leaders of leading industrialised democracies in Venice and of farm trade talks at the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) in May.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He said that although Japan provides the world's highest level of subsidies per acre, its subsidy per farm family was several times lower than in the United States.

lst.name: sentence
